explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: 3M's documentation describes the acquisition and integration of AI technology into physician workflows and describes a strategic approach to AI implementation. It also outlines plans for AI applications and scaling, along with intent for controlled integration of AI. Additionally, a press release references the use of AWS services, implying reliance on vendor governance requirements for AI.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This press release announcing the "Ask 3M" AI-powered assistant provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars. While it describes the AI's capabilities and use case for design challenges, it lacks explicit details on operational execution or governance mechanisms. However, the mention of using AWS services implies a reliance on vendor governance and transparency requirements for the AI.
relevant_sources.title: 3M Ask 3M AI-Powered Assistant Launch

relevant_sources.summary: This press release for "3M M*Modal CDI Engage One - AI Clinical Documentation" provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. It supports governance by describing the acquisition and integration of AI technology into physician workflows, indicating a strategic approach to AI implementation. Transparency is supported by detailing how the AI and NLU technologies analyze EHR notes in real-time to identify documentation gaps, offering insight into the system's operational mechanisms.
relevant_sources.title: 3M M*Modal CDI Engage One - AI Clinical Documentation

relevant_sources.summary: This press release describes a strategic AI partnership that provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. The document supports governance by outlining plans for AI applications and scaling, suggesting intent for controlled integration. Transparency is evidenced through the description of AI/IoT platform capabilities for predictions and the listing of various AI applications and their functionalities.
relevant_sources.title: 3M and C3.ai Strategic AI Partnership

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.findings: 3M's documentation describes how its AI and NLU technologies analyze EHR notes in real-time to identify documentation gaps and describes their operational mechanisms. It also describes AI/IoT platform capabilities for predictions and various AI applications and their functionalities. Furthermore, a press release references the use of AWS services, implying reliance on vendor transparency requirements for AI.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

Transparency is supported by detailing how the AI and NLU technologies analyze EHR notes in real-time to identify documentation gaps, offering insight into the system's operational mechanisms.

The document supports governance by outlining plans for AI applications and scaling, suggesting intent for controlled integration. summary.overall_findings: 3M's documentation describes how AI and NLU technologies analyze EHR notes in real-time to identify documentation gaps, addressing the transparency pillar. Additionally, published materials reference the acquisition and integration of AI technology into physician workflows, contributing to the governance pillar, and overall, 2 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars have documented evidence. Drawing from 8 publicly available sources, no qualifying public evidence was found for the majority of the 7 evaluated pillars.
